page.title: 13ARTS AND CRAFTS
page.content:
{Little Parndon Mill} This fine building was taken over as a craft centre some fifteen years ago and now gives accommodation to a blacksmith, a painter, a picture framer, two potters and a sculptor. We visited the foundry and talked to Clive Hick and Chas who use aluminium and bronze for their castings of model cars, badges, go-cart mountings, sword handles and computer components.
Parndon Mill's most celebrated occupant is its present owner, Sally Anderson, who has worked here since she set up as a designer in ceramics and tiles fifteen years ago. She claims to be self-sufficient in food, growing vegetables and keeping sheep, rabbits and a goat.
